result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin M Wavruk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Justin M Wavruk in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler. Defendant Justin M Wavruk in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 13CF-322 and 14CF-233.

10:47 AM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Matters are set for a sentencing hearing on revocation.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, reviews previous sentencings. 
Defendant will only be sentenced on Count 2 in 14CF-233.
State requests 9 months for reasons stated on the record.
Defendant still has a pending case that is being negotiated, 15CF-350. 
144 days credit to be applied to any sentence the Court orders.
State recommends: 13CF-322 : $1224.29 restitution and court costs to be converted to civil judgment; 14CF-233: $23.85 restitution and court costs to be converted to civil judgment

Atty Kessler addresses the Court, requests 6 months in jail, to be served on monitor or a treatment facility.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court regarding 13CF-322, Defendant plead to each of the four courts. 14CF-233 Count 2 was a misdemeanor court.
Defendant is here today to be sentenced on the 5 counts.

Court addresses the parties, has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
13CF-322
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 9 Months
144 Days Jail Credit
Last 3 Months eligible for Huber for employment and treatment and counseling
Court will consider Defendant to serve time on huber in such a facility program if recommended

Comply with recommendations, if any are made, with respect to AODA treatment

Court will consider Defendant to serve time on huber in such a facility program if recommended

Defendant Justin M Wavruk in court with attorney Jerod Albert Barkley. Defendant Justin M Wavruk in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 13CF322, 13CT78, 14CF233 and 14TR2754.

10:35 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Atty Cousins indicates that he would be able to provide an amended information.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Atty Barkley indicates that an amended information has already been filed on 13CF322.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
13CF322:
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - No contest
Count 3 - No contest
Count 4 - No contest

13CT78:
Count 1 - No contest

14CF233:
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - No contest
Count 3 - DRI

14TR2754:
Count 1 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on all charges in case's 13CF322, 13CT78 and 14CF233 and 14CF233 Count 3 is DRI and 14TR2754 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty  Barkley makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Defendant makes statements to the Court prior to his sentencing.

22 days in county jail
13 days credit
Huber priveleges for work and aoda treatment
Pay fine of $1,235.00 + costs
Pay blood draw of $26.45
Pay within 60 days or set up a payment plan
15 month DL revocation;  Revocation is retroactive to the date of the administrative suspension from the Dept. of Transportation
15 month IID on any vehicles owned, titled in his name or that he drives effective today's date
Complete an Alcohol/Drug Assessment or Department of Transportation Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommendations.

Count 1 -
Sentence withheld

75 days conditional jail, consecutive to with huber privileges granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. 
Pay fine of $1,200.00 + costs; totalling $2,452.00 
Pay blood draw of $26.45
31 month DL revocation; Revocation is retroactive to the date of the administrative suspension from the Dept. of Transportation and concurrent to 13CT78
31 month IID on any vehicles owned, operated or titled in his name concurrent with IID in 13CT78 effective today's date
Complete an Alcohol/Drug Assessment or Department of Transportation Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommendations.
Any bond monies to be applied to fine if applicable
Fines/costs to be paid within 60 days or set up payment plan

Sentence withheld concurrent to 13CF322

Comply with conditions in 13CF322
Pay costs

Plea hearing on December 3, 2014 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Justin M Wavruk in court with attorney Jerod Albert Barkley. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:17 p.m.  Court calls the cases.  Also heard with 13CF322 & 13CT78.  Atty Cousins states appearances.  Court states this is regarding a letter he received from Atty Barkley.  Atty Barkley states the request from his letter.  Atty Barkley states they do have an agreement with the State.  Atty Barkley states the Motion is to excused the Defendant's non-appearance at Day Report on the dates states.  Atty Barkley would like the Day Report be reinstated.  Atty Cousins agrees.  

BTC:  Court will excuse the Defendant from going to Day Report from July 8, 2014 until August 14, 2014.  The Warrant is to be vacated.  Defendant is to go back on Day Report, without having to go to jail.

Atty Cousins states there was a Wage Assignment of $50.00, and he was imformed the Defendant was behind in the amount of $150.00.  Atty Barkley states reasons for nonpayment, and that the Defendant will be making the payment to get caught up.
Dated 7/23 re: warrant
Pre-trial conference on September 22, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Waiver filed.  14TR2754 to be scheduled for pretrial also.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 11:00 am.
